title.narrative: 2.1. INCLUSIVE SECONDARY EDUCATION

description.narrative: By 2021, the national and priority regional governments will have built their capacities to design and implement inclusive, relevant and quality secondary education policies that ensure successful development paths for indigenous, rural and marginal-urban adolescents., which contributes to Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, the adolescent population will have improved opportunities to live a healthy life, learn throughout their life and fully exercise their citizenship

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, the national and priority regional governments will have built their capacities to design and implement inclusive, relevant and quality secondary education policies that ensure successful development paths for indigenous, rural and marginal-urban adolescents.

description.narrative: UNICEF contributed to the National Policy on Adolescent Education and Well-being, strengthened diversified education services, and deepened the analysis of gender barriers in school access and retention. Evidence-based advocacy, capacity-building initiatives, and implementation of an innovative model in 52 schools have contributed to new comprehensive approaches to inform educational policies. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of authorities and regional, provincial and district officials with ability to manage modalities of secondary education with intercultural and gender approaches.
Number of organizations that develop actions for the requirement of new approaches of secondary education in prioritized areas.
Number of spaces and active intersectoral and intergovernmental mechanisms that boost the comprehensive development for adolescents.
Number of children supported with distance/home-based learning [COVIDSitRep]
System Strengthening - Gender - Existence of a school re-entry policy/strategy for pregnant girls and/or adolescent mothers - score (1-4), see guidance
Number of institutionalized secondary education modalities for adolescents in indigenous, rural and urban-marginal contexts with intercultural and gender approaches.

target.value: 2021:4 in score 3 (modality in implementation ¿ pilot Project).

actual.value: 2019:3 in score 2. The Residential, IBE and Alternating service models have been approved.

title.narrative: Allocated budget for secondary education remains or increase.

baseline.value: National: 5,764,981,947 soles, Lima: 141,675,702 soles, Huancavelica: 105,001,071 soles, Loreto: 154,531,653, Ucayali: 69,348,825 soles

target.value: 2021:Exceed the average increase for Education sector.

actual.value: 2019:National: 8,016,154,623 The budget allocated for secondary education in the 4 prioritized territories has maintained (Huancavelica 7%) and increased (Loreto 23%, Lima 9% and Ucayali 11%), exceeding or increasing the average for the education sector (7%).

title.narrative: Degree of design and implementation of the National Plan and Policy for the strengthening of secondary education.

baseline.value: Score 0: There is not any policy or plan.

target.value: 2021:Score 4: Policy and plan disseminated and incorporated into the annual management guidelines, and as a reference for the budgeting process of the sub-system of secondary education.

title.narrative: Degree of incorporation and implementation of comprehensive sex education in all secondary schools, in prioritized territories.

baseline.value: Score 1: There is not any type of comprehensive sex education in the majority of secondary schools.

target.value: 2021:Score 4: School teachers of at least 30% of secondary schools are trained in the use of the curriculum that incorporates comprehensive sex education.

actual.value: 2019:Level 3. The national curriculum incorporates comprehensive sex education, but challenges remain: adequate and sufficient educational materials, teacher training and monitoring systems.
